channel.title: Is this normal for a server cmd prompt to show this?
channel.description:
just wondering. it shows something in the black command prompt. allways had =/ iv been wondering what it was
i cant take a pic atm but il try to describe with detail
"connection from (weird ip adress's) : 2777 <---(mostly random 4 digit numbers) ClientHandler: Client null disconected <*ipadress's from god knows were...*> "
I get so many of these... and i mean ALOT up to 30-40 per minute >.> thats all u see. u see soem 1 log on then u see a bunch of those connection from thing then null =/ some 1 please help me out? take a minute to post and help plz=] servers been up for a month to so idk what it is =[

item.title: Is this normal for a server cmd prompt to show this?
item.dc:creator: @webbsta webbsta
item.description:
@webbsta wrote:

You can either:

  1. Limit the amount of connections from a certain address.
    or
  2. Detect a null connection from the start and then just drop the socket, which means they can try but it won’t affect the performance of your server.

Option 1 is probably the best though.

Read full topic
item.source: Is this normal for a server cmd prompt to show this?
